ai.summary: Castle Flannan is an ultra-short coastal walk in the UK, offering a quick, easy outing with a view of the shoreline. At about 0.1 km, this route takes only a few minutes and is suitable for most abilities.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat coastal path with occasional rocky or muddy patches. The short distance belies exposed winds and potential spray from the sea, so footing can be slippery when wet.
ai.safety_notes: Stay on marked paths; cliffs and drop-offs can be dangerous. Check weather, tide times, and wind forecasts before you go. Wear sturdy, closed-toe footwear and dress in layers. Keep a safe distance from the edge and supervise children or pets closely. Carry a charged phone and a basic map in case of detours.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn are ideal in the UK for this short coastal hike, with milder weather and clearer seas. Winter visits are possible but can be windy, wet, and less comfortable.

seo.title: Castle Flannan: Easy 0.1 km Coastal Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Enjoy a brief, easy coastal hike to Castle Flannan in the UK. A 0.1 km route with practical safety tips, gear suggestions, and best seasons.
